shortdesc.ph: The class that manages the configuration of bypass streaming and transcoding.

pd.p: The width of the video in pixels. The default value is 360.

ul.li: When pushing video streams to the CDN, ensure that `width` is at least 64; otherwise, the Agora server adjusts the value to 64.
When pushing audio streams to the CDN, set `width` and `height` as 0.

pd.p: The height of the video in pixels. The default value is 640.

ul.li: When pushing video streams to the CDN, ensure that `height` is at least 64; otherwise, the Agora server adjusts the value to 64.
When pushing audio streams to the CDN, set `width` and `height` as 0.

plentry.pd: Bitrate of the CDN live output video stream. The minimum encoding bitrate (Kbps). The default value is 400 Kbps. Set this parameter according to the Video Bitrate Table. If you set a bitrate beyond the proper range, the SDK automatically adapts it to a value within the range.

Frame rate of the output video stream set for the CDN live streaming. The default value is 15 fps, and the value range is (0,30]. The default value is 15.@note The Agora server adjusts any value over 30 to 30.

dlentry.dd: This attribute is obsolete since v2.8.0, and Agora does not recommend it.

ul.li: true: Low latency with unassured quality.
false: (Default) High latency with assured quality.

plentry.pd: Video GOP (in frames) of the injected stream in the interactive live streaming. The unit is frame. The default value is 1.0.

pd.p: For the encoding specifications of the push-stream output video, see for details.
pd.note: @note If you set this parameter to other values, Agora adjusts it to the default value of 100.

plentry.pd: The background color in RGB hex value. Value only. Do not include a preceeding #. For example, 0xFFB6C1 (light pink). The default value is 0x000000 (black).
The number of users in the interactive live streaming.

pd.p: Manages the user layout configuration in the CDN live streaming. This layout supports up to 17 users.

plentry.pd: Reserved parameters: user-defined information sent to the bypass push client. Reserved property. Extra user-defined information to send SEI for the H.264/H.265 video stream to the CDN live client. Maximum length: 4096 Bytes. For detailed information about SEI, see SEI frame related issues.

Deprecated: This mode is deprecated.
DEPRECATED The metadata sent to the CDN live client defined by the RTMP or HTTP-FLV metadata.
This method supports adding a watermark image in the PNG file format only. Once a watermark image is added, the audience of the CDN live publishing stream can see the watermark image. See RtcImage.
The background image added to the CDN live publishing stream. Once a background image is added, the audience of the CDN live publishing stream can see the background image. See RtcImage.
The audio sampling rate (Hz) of the push stream output, see for details.
Bitrate of the CDN live audio output stream. The default value is 48 Kbps, and the highest value is 128.

The numbder of audio channels for the CDN live stream. Agora recommends choosing 1 (mono), or 2 (stereo) audio channels. Special players are required if you choose option 3, 4, or
- 1: (Default) Mono
- 2: Stereo
- 3: Three audio channels
- 4: Four audio channels
- 5: Five audio channels
For the encoding specifications of the push-stream output video, see for details.
